Protest Boycott Donate Advocate Support Immigrants

FixICE curates a selection of anti-ICE websites discovered through extensive searching and ongoing exploration. The site highlights resources for building political power and winning elections, showing how changing government policy and leadership can directly support anti-ICE efforts. It also shares information about protests held at 1000 District Avenue in Burlington. There are many excellent organizations and resources doing important work. This site is not comprehensive — it is a curated selection of personal favorites, organized by type of activity and area of focus.

Want more guided and detailed “how do I start?” information?

If you’re looking for step-by-step guidance on how to get involved or start something new, we highly recommend: Choose Democracy website.

It’s an excellent resource for understanding how individual actions add up—and how to begin.
